headline: BAT profit beats estimates as US, its biggest market, returns to growth
summary: BATS said it expects annual revenue growth to come in at the top end of its forecast range.  The maker of Lucky Strike and Dunhill cigarettes said revenue in the U.S., which makes up about 44% of total sales, grew 3.7% at constant currency, with Velo, its nicotine pouches, helping sales of its new category products grow 3.9%.  BAT and peers such as Philip Morris, Imperial Brands, and Altria are trying to capture a bigger share of the vapes, tobacco heating product and oral nicotine pouches market as sales drop in traditional tobacco products.

BAT and peers such as Philip Morris, Imperial Brands, and Altria are trying to capture a bigger share of the vapes, tobacco heating product and oral nicotine pouches market as sales drop in traditional tobacco products.

headline: Altria (MO) Extends $3B Credit Line Amid Strong Dividend History
summary: Altria Group, Inc. (NYSE:MO) is one of the defensive stocks that billionaires are buying amid US trade tariff uncertainty. On July 23, Altria Group announced an extension of its $3.0 billion five-year revolving credit agreement, shifting the expiration date from October 2028 to October 2029. The deal, originally signed in October 2023, involves JPMorgan Chase […]
